monogr.title: A touch-stone for a Christian : Wherein is shewed, how a man may know, whether he be the Temple of the Holy Ghost, hath a sauing faith, be the childe of God, hath truly repented, and (in one word) be a Christian in deed, or in name onely. By Thomas Broade
monogr.author: Broad, Thomas

div.head: TO THE RIGHT WORSHIPFVLL Sir William Killygrew, Sir Robert Killygrew, and to the vertuous Ladies their wiues: Increase of wisedome and fauour with God and man.
div.p:
RIght worshipfull, you shall rightly so bee called, if you worship God aright: And thus you doe vndoubtedly, if you worship him in Spirit and truth: for the Father requireth such worshippers. But thus for certaine you
cannot doe, vnlesse his Spirit dwelleth in you; which I hope it doth plentifully, and pray it may still more abundantly, vntill you come to dwell with God in the kingdome of heauen. The kinde entertainment I once found in your house, makes me indebted more than I am able to discharge: my God that dwelleth in his house, I meane, your bodies, repay it ten fold into your bosomes, or hearts rather; for the bosome receiueth the transitorie, but the heart the true treasure; & God (you know) dwelleth within, not without his holy Temple.

This Temple of God, your bodies, giue me leaue to put
you in minde (though not inmindfull already) to adorne on the inside in the best manner, that so the glorious beautie thereof being seene of men, it may redound to the praise and glorie of the builder and housholder: for it is strange to see the folly of many in this last and worst age of the world, who take great paines & bestow much cost in beautifying the outside vntill it euen shine again with gold & pretious stones. The fashion now adaies is changed euery day, and yet they can neuer light vpon the right fashion. For the Temple was couered with lead on the outside, and on the inside was ouerlaid with
pure gold. It were good then for those which are couered with gold, and are so glorious without, to beware lest within they bee ouerlaied with lead, or such like base metall. Doe men vse to paint Churches on the out-side, where the winde and weather would soone cause the colour to fade away? Let the hid man of the heart be trimmed vp in the best manner, paint heere as much as you will, spare no paines, spare no cost, let it be done in colours of gold, vntill you shine againe as lights in the middest of a froward generation: this is a pretious thing in the sight of that God which dwelleth in you.

As a token of my loue and vnfained affection, I heere present you with the First-fruits of my labours: First-fruits I call them, but in that sense happily as Christ was Maries First-borne, when as she neuer had other childe. If you kindly accept hereof, I haue part of my desire: if you and others profit heereby, I haue all, and God too (I trust) who set mee on worke; for he willeth not the death of a sinner, and I would not be a sauour of death vnto any. My hearty praier then vnto this our gracious God is, so to blesse this little mite cast into the Treasurie for the repairing of his house, that it may helpe to build
you vp daily more & more, vntill you reach to the heauenly Ierusalem; where I hope in Christ our Sauiour to dwell with you once againe, and world without end. God send vs a ioifull meeting. In the meane time, whiles I liue, I will rest

closer.signed: Your Worships in all dutie, Thomas Broade.
